The Other Environmental Crisis

Human interaction probably isn‚Äôt in danger of extinction, but it is quietly losing great swaths of its natural habitat. Technology is making real interaction less necessary at work, home, and everywhere in between, which must mean there‚Äôs simply less of it in the world than there was a decade ago.

This loss is due to environmental degradation, just of a new sort. The environments life happens in‚Äîworkplaces, homes, public areas, airports, stores‚Äîare becoming less hospitable to the natural proliferation of eye contact, meaningful dialogue, and empathy than they once were.

So maybe we should be thinking about conservation efforts. We can‚Äôt opt out of automated technologies completely, but we can re-establish the board game night, the potluck dinner, the block party, the book club, and other environments where real interaction thrives naturally.

If you live to be 88‚Ä¶you have 11 opportunities to be great at something.
